title: Ironworkers
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415025718im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ironworkers_5493.jpg)

Whats the font?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [ironworkers.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415025718/http:/typophile.com/files/ironworkers.jpg) | 49.41 KB |
author: tammeyim

comments.content: do you know what is this font?
The letters look like they are photographs of pipe cleaners bent into the shape of the letter.
Not a match, but it looks close to **[Adage Script JF](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415025718/http:/marketplace.veer.com/type/JBT0000002)** by Jason Anthony Walcott [2002, JAW Fonts]

I think it resembles a blend of two scripts: Monotype [Monoline Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415025718/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/monoline+script+mt/fonts/?refby=bowfin) and [Fiona Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415025718/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/brassfonts/fiona-script/?refby=bowfin) from Brassfonts. Notice the o and w loops and the r shape of the latter font. However the I is all wrong, as are the k and s shapes, but that's where Monoline Script comes in.

The shapes are not exact, but I could imagine this being a design compromise to make the embroidery lettering easier to read.

- Mike Yanega

100% match with "Ravi Script," a font for an embroidery machine -- definitely not "photographs of pipe cleaners."

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415025718im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Ravi_Script_4371.jpg)
 For details see [http://www.milligift.com/products/fonts.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415025718/http:/www.milligift.com/products/fonts.html "http://www.milligift.com/products/fonts.html")  
Still searching for a digital version that you can use as a regular desktop or web font.  
Don

I believe that Monoline Script -- already mentioned by Mike Yanega -- has the letter forms used as the basis for much of this script. Some letters such as \_f\_ look almost identical, others such as \_A\_ or \_k\_ have the same basic form but have been modified to make some of the strokes more flourished. The result seems less mechanical than Monoline Script, and perhaps has improved legibility when embroidered.  
Don
Yes, I took the font pic from the jacket. (embroidery)
Yes, I think the font is Ravi Script.
